page.title: 01THE ENVIRONS OF RHOOSE
page.content: Rhoose is an expanding village - virtually a small town - which has endeavoured to maintain the "village" traditions. The area under scrutiny has four main features- {a)Cardiff-Wales Airport. {b)The expanding residential area. {c)The rich farmland of the Vale of { Glamorgan. {d)A limestone-cliffed coastline. To the east is the town of{Barry(4 {miles)}and the{City of Cardiff(13 miles).To the west lies the main extent of the{Vale of Glamorgan}which} is dotted with small villages and hamlets.In{Aberthaw,}a village to the} west of Rhoose, there is a large {Portland Cement}works as well as two {C.E.G.B. power stations.}These two sites provide work for a large number of the population. Most others work in Cardiff or at R.A.F. St.Athan 6m.west.
